sentences: Minu jaoks on kivid ülimalt huvitavad.
context: The Estonian word 'huvitav' is an adjective that means interesting, intriguing or fascinating. It's the present active participle of the verb 'huvitama' (to interest). The word follows regular Estonian declension patterns and has comparative forms like 'huvitavam' (more interesting) and superlative forms like 'kõige huvitavam' or 'huvitavaim' (most interesting). In colloquial speech, it can also express surprise, astonishment, or criticism in interrogative and exclamatory sentences.
